meanings.definition: Relating to or involving dynamics or energy.
meanings.sent1: The dynamitic performance of the athletes amazed the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The dynamitic music at the concert got everyone dancing.
meanings.sent3: The dynamitic dance moves of the penguin made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her dynamitic personality lit up the room like a burst of sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The dynamitic explosion in the movie was so realistic it made me jump.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or causing rapid change or action.
meanings.sent1: The dynamitic weather made it hard to plan outdoor activities.
meanings.sent2: The dynamitic market fluctuations kept investors on their toes.
meanings.sent3: The dynamitic squirrel darted across the yard, surprising the cat.
meanings.sent4: His dynamitic ideas sparked a wave of creativity in the team.
meanings.sent5: The dynamitic pace of the race left everyone breathless at the finish line.

meanings.sent1: The dynamitic fireworks lit up the night sky with bright colors.
meanings.sent2: The dynamitic volcano eruption caused chaos in the surrounding area.
meanings.sent3: The dynamitic sneeze startled everyone in the quiet library.
meanings.sent4: The dynamitic engine roared to life, propelling the car forward.
meanings.sent5: The dynamitic impact of the collision left a trail of destruction in its wake.
